fact: Did you know? The first electronic computer, ENIAC, weighed over 27 tons.
Did you know? Computers process data in binary, using only 0s and 1s.
Did you know? The first hard drive, released in 1956, could store only 5MB of data.
Did you know? RAM stands for Random Access Memory and stores data temporarily.
Did you know? The first commercial computer, UNIVAC I, was delivered in 1951.
Did you know? CPUs are often called the brain of a computer because they execute instructions.
Did you know? Early computers had no keyboards; operators used punch cards to input data.
Did you know? Moore's Law predicts the number of transistors on a chip doubles every 2 years.
Did you know? The first computer bug was an actual moth found in a Harvard Mark II computer.
Did you know? SSDs are faster than HDDs because they have no moving parts.
Did you know? Supercomputers can perform quadrillions of calculations per second.
